page.title: 10Cheriton Fitzpaine - Farming
page.content: The milking cows are British Friesians. When they are young their horns have to be cut off to stop them fighting each other. The cows can catch diseases such as mastitis and ring worm. Recently 38 cows had to be sold as the farm was producing more milk than its quota allowed by the EEC. There is one Hereford bull on the farm. The calves fathered by the bull are fattened for two years and then slaughtered for{meat.}Some of the meat is sold direct to local people.The rest of the cows receive artificial insemination and their cow calves are kept for milking. The cattle are fed on{grass, silage,}sugar beet, cow cake and barley. Nearly all the fields are used for grass and silage. A few acres are used for barley which is stored for winter feed.
